H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H838.def: literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2784.def: literally: cords used to bind people so that they cannot freely move about; hence: = things that affect the life of a person and from which that person cannot easily free him/herself

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H193.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = human body, or part of it

H1277.def: = state in which a human or animal has a lot of excess fat; ≈ considered a sign of health and wealth

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1346.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

glosses: (an activity) serves as a necklace > to be fully engaged (in a certain activity)
H6059.def: literally: to serve as a necklace; hence: = state in which humans are totally engaged in a certain activity ◄ as if they were wearing it as a necklace

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

8.gl: to clothe oneself (with an activity) > to be fully engaged (with an activity)

4.gl: (an activity) serves as a necklace > to be fully engaged (in a certain activity)

H2459.def: = fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4906.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4167.def: = action by which humans utter words that are intended to provoke shame in other humans

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H8371.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4680.def: = causative process by which humans cause a container to be emptied of all liquids

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H1844.def: = state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H7961.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H7685.def: = process by which a plant grows in size

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H7385.def: = state in which a container does not contain anything

H2135.def: = state in which someone is considered as upright and innocent in character and behavior

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5356.def: literally: cleanness of teeth; hence: = state of being without food

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2513.def: = object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H4876.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H8047.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H2472.def: = process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H6754.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non-sanctioned rituals or as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1198.def: = state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H7607.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H6789.def: = process by which liquids disappear from existence, as a result of warm weather

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

14.gl: to put their trust (in someone else)
